support_summary: Loss of nuclear TDP-43 function alters the alternative splicing of POLDIP3 pre-mRNA. This leads to an increased production of POLDIP3 variant-2, which is less effective at promoting the mTOR/S6K1 signaling pathway, ultimately resulting in decreased mRNA translation and reduced cell size in neuronal cells.

functions.cellular_process: Nuclear TDP-43 promotes the inclusion of exon 3 in POLDIP3 pre-mRNA, leading to the production of POLDIP3 variant-1. When nuclear TDP-43 function is lost, exon 3 is skipped, increasing the ratio of POLDIP3 variant-2. This isoform shift downregulates the mTOR/S6K1 signaling pathway, which is critical for mRNA translation and cell growth.
functions.effect_description: Loss of nuclear TDP-43 function indirectly downregulates mTOR-dependent mRNA translation and reduces cell size by altering the splicing of the upstream regulator POLDIP3.
biological_consequence: Loss of nuclear TDP-43 function → POLDIP3 pre-mRNA splicing is altered, causing exon 3 skipping → Ratio of POLDIP3 variant-2 to variant-1 increases → mTORC1 pathway signaling is attenuated → S6K1-mediated mRNA translation is downregulated → Neuronal cell size is reduced
specific_effects: Depletion of nuclear TDP-43 decreases wild-type POLDIP3 (variant-1) and increases the POLDIP3 isoform lacking exon 3 (variant-2).
The POLDIP3 variant-2 is less effective than variant-1 at maintaining cell size in neuronal cells depleted of TDP-43.
Depletion of TDP-43 in the SH-SY5Y neuronal cell line leads to a significant decrease in cell size, an effect comparable to POLDIP3 depletion.
